org.jay3d.engine.core.math

Class Matrix4f

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jay3d.engine.core.math.Matrix4f

  • public class Matrix4f
extends java.lang.Object
    The Matrix class maintains a four by four(4x4) matrix in row order.

    Matrix4f is used to apply translation and/or rotation, which includes multiple convenience methods for creating the Matrices, tranforming them by vectors or rotating them.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Matrix4f()
      Constructs and initialises a new four by four(4x4) Matrix

    • Method Detail

      • initIdentity

        public Matrix4f initIdentity()
        the current matrix will be set to the identity matrix. This is generally all zeros with ones diagonally.
        Returns:
        Matrix values set to the identity matrix

      • initTranslation

        public Matrix4f initTranslation(float x,
                                float y,
                                float z)
        More commonly known as setTranslation. This will set the Matrix's translation values
        Parameters:
        x - Translation on the x-axis
        y - Translation on the y-axis
        z - Translation on the z-axis
        Returns:
        The current Matrix with the new translation values

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        New Vector3f with it's transformed values.

                          float y,

        z - Increment of decrement z value
        Returns:
        Current Matrix with new scale values

      • initPerspective

        public Matrix4f initPerspective(float fov,
                                float aspect,
                                float zNear,
                                float zFar)
        Initialises the Matrix's perspective values. This is mainly used by the Camera class to set things like, field of view, aspect ration, nearest distance and furthest distance.

        Example: initPerspective(90, width/height, 0.001f, 1000f) Do note that width and height used in the example are usually the Window's width and height.

        Parameters:
        fov - The desired field of view to set the matrix to
        aspect - The desired aspect ration to set the matrix to
        zNear - The nearest distance to set the matrix to
        zFar - The furthest distance to set the matrix to
        Returns:
        Current matrix with new perspective values

      • initOrthographic

        public Matrix4f initOrthographic(float left,
                                 float right,
                                 float bottom,
                                 float top,
                                 float near,
                                 float far)
        Orthographic respesents 3D object in 2D, a derivative of parallel projection.

        In computer graphics, orthographic is generally defined by a 6-tuple which is what is used in this engine. This includes, left, right, bottom, top, near far. These act as the clipping planes, thus form a box consisting of the minimum corner(left, bottom, -near) and the maximum right, (right, top, -far).

        Parameters:
        left - The left value, this forms part of the minimum corner.
        right - The right value, this forms part of the maximum corner.
        bottom - The bottom value, this forms part of the minimum corner.
        top - The top value, this forms part of the maximum corner.
        near - The near value, this forms part of the minimum corner. Do not invert the near value prior to passing it as a parameter. Matrix4f#initOrthographic does this automatically for you.
        far - The far value, this forms part of the maximum corner, Do not invert the near value prior to passing it as a parameter. Matrix4f#initOrthographic does this automatically for you.
        Returns:
        The current matrix with orthographic projection.

      • initRotation

        public Matrix4f initRotation(Vector3f forward,
                             Vector3f up)
        Initialises the matrix's rotation by converting Vector3f to fit the Matrix#initRotation(Vector3f forward, Vector3f up, Vector3f right).
        Parameters:
        forward - The Vector3f displaying the forward direction.
        up - The Vector3f displaying the up direction.
        Returns:
        Current Matrix with new rotational values.

      • initRotation

        public Matrix4f initRotation(Vector3f forward,
                             Vector3f up,
                             Vector3f right)
        Initialises the matrix's rotation by using forward, up and right values. Similar to the right-hand rule.
        Parameters:
        forward - The Vector3f displaying the forward direction.
        up - The Vector3f displaying the up direction.
        right - The Vector3f displaying the right direction.
        Returns:
        Current Matrix with new rotational values.

      • mul

        public Matrix4f mul(Matrix4f matrix)
        Simply multiplies current Matrix by another Matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix to multiply current matrix with.
        Returns:
        Matrix with new multiplied values
